fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29103].
  {panel}

h3. Problem:

When attaching files with special characters (like testⅢ.txt) users often complain about not been able to remove it. 
So every time they have to appeal to [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Cannot+Delete+Attachments+with+Special+Characters+in+Name], that requires the user to access the database and make some manually steps.

h3. Feature:

It would be great if Confluence show a warning, saying that the filename has special characters that could result in issues, specially when using drag and drop feature.
fields.summary: Warn users about files with special characters
Misleading message in Confluence Search Syntax

fields.description:
NoPrint user macro unable to render the contents of other user macro(eg. recently updated) in IE8 only.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create [NoPrint Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/NoPrint+Example+of+a+User+Macro]
# Create a new page and add the NoPrint Macro
# Within the NoPrint macro body insert the "Recently Updated" macro
# Save the page and view the page in an IE8 browser.  

Tested in IE9, IE10, Chrome, Firefox and those browsers are working fine.
fields.summary: NoPrint user macro not rendering the contents of other macro in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29099].
  {panel}

Even though, comment field is next to Save button in Confluence, it is REALLY easy to forget and save a document without comment.

Solution:
If user presses CTRL+S or Save button, a pop-up box would appear asking to confirm. If comment field is not empty then pop-up box should not appear.

There is a similar Improvement logged already. Please check:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-20786
However, this one talks about another useful feature, i.e. adding comments AFTER saving document.

My solution requires confirmation BEFORE saving document. If user wants to save changes WITHOUT comment, he will be allowed to do so. He just needs to confirm this.
fields.summary: Before saving changes WITHOUT any comments, add a confirmation box

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29097].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When Documentation theme is applied throughout Confluence in Site Theme, the Space Theme is showing incorrect option.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Confluence Site Theme to be Documentation Theme. 
# Go to Space Admin and configure Space Theme. The current theme will be Global Look and Feel theme (Default Theme). But it is in fact configured as Documentation Theme, opted from Site Theme. 

h4. Screenshot
When the Site Theme is Default Theme, the Space Theme will be
!default-theme.png!

When the Site Theme is Documentation Theme, the Space Theme will be
!doc-theme.png!
fields.summary: Theme selection error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29096].
  {panel}

In my organization, we would like to benefit from the great features of Confluence and a knowledge management QA system like OSQA, but would not like to have the problem of separate information, lack of integration and dual administration. Basically we would love to do what you have done with OSQA. 

The problem is that now these tools are not integrated. Few things we’re interested in:
- interactions that happen in OSQA are visible in Confluence’s notifications box
- labels in OSQA are the same as those in Confluence, allowing users to find related stuff and subscribe
- searchability from Confluence to both databases
- merged profiles 
- merged activity streams
fields.summary: Make OSQA (a.k.a. AnswerHub) a fully integrated plugin for Confluence

fields.description:
Both HtmlExporter.java and FileXmlExporter.java use the prepareExportFileName method inherited from [AbstractExporterImpl.java|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/importexport/impl/AbstractExporterImpl.java#98] in forming a path to use for the zip file location (archivePath & zipFileName, respectively) which uses the user controlled space key[0] in the returned path and are thus vulnerable to path traversal. 

[0] personal space keys are allowed to contain "." and "/" characters.
fields.summary: Path traversal in HtmlExporter.java and FileXmlExporter.java
Replace favicon with smaller version of the file.

fields.description: The HTML markup returned by the two {{renderContent}} methods contains relative URLs for images, links, etc. For example, a "user mention" link is rendered as follows: {code}Joe Bloggs{code} This is not terribly useful when the caller is not the target Confluence instance. For example, a JIRA plugin obtaining this content would attempt to resolve the above {{href}} URL (i.e. {{/display/~admin}}) within its own hostname and servlet context. There is a workaround that involves prefixing the above {{href}} with the above {{data-base-url}}, but this is fairly ugly, as it involves scanning and modifying the entire rendered content, noting that URLs can appear in many places and may already be absolute in some cases.
fields.summary: XML-RPC "renderContent" methods return relative URLs

fields.description:
I use Jira issues in a Confluence page. This Jira Issues is based on a Jira query. I'haved set the cache option to 'on'.

1/ When I come to the page, the Jira Issue is up to date. --> OK
2/ In Jira, I modify one issue, so, the result of the query change in jira --> OK
3/ When I'm back in my Confluence'page, the Jira Issues is up to date. --> KO. I need to found the oldest state of my Jira Issue.
fields.summary: Jira Issues - Cache doesn't work

fields.description:
While I saw another bug reported for inconsistent text colour changes when applied to a list, I have found another issue that necessitates a new issue report: Data is being moved when I change the text colour en masse in a list.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a new page and create a numbered list. 
2) Add some random text and create a list hierarchy such as the following:
1 - a - b - 2 - a - i - 3 - a - b - i - ii - 4 - a - i - ii
3) Either click and drag to select all, or Ctrl + a.
4) Click the colour palette drop-down and select a different colour. 
Step result: Hierarchical levels are inconsistently coloured and, more importantly, data is moved. Some lines are now empty, with this missing text having been added to a previous list item. 

This is causing some frustration and delay in my company, and I`d love to see this bug squashed! I`ll attach screenshots if I can figure out how. Thanks for your time,

Greg
fields.summary: Significant Issues when changing text colour of a list
Ability to report which content is popular so that content owners can know where to focus their efforts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29073].
  {panel}

The new editor does not properly create links that do not use one of the standard web protocols when inserting with the Insert Link dialog (e.g. http://, ftp://).  It creates the <a> but without a href attribute.  In 3.5 and earlier, you could create a link for any protocol type using wiki markup: \[something://mysite.com\].  Inserting the wiki markup results in the link being stripped and the URI appearing as plaintext.

The only workaround is to insert a link manually with the HTML macro, but not all sites will be able to enable this macro for security reasons.


---
The fix in 4.3.7 allows non-standard protocols, but not if they have numbers in the protocol.

e.g. exp://Ticket/12345 works fine but exp2://Ticket/12345 is not rendered as a link.
fields.summary: Non-standard protocol links with numbers aren't rendered as links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29072].
  {panel}

Users are being duplicated in the People directory each time Confluence is restarted, until a re-index is performed (at which time the duplicates are removed).

If you encounter a bug where your people directory is displaying duplicates and this _isn't_ fixed by performing a re-index, it's likely that you're affected by CONF-30050.

Please take a look at this Knowledge Base article for more information:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicates+in+the+People+Directory

h2. Workaround
*Step 1.* [Rebuild the search index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration#ContentIndexAdministration-RebuildingtheContentIndexes] to remove the duplicates in the people directory.
*Step 2.* Perform an action that will add a different type of indexing task to the queue before your instance is restarted - e.g. create a page in Confluence.

If this doesn't work for you, please [raise a support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa] so that we can investigate further.
fields.summary: Users are duplicated in People Directory each time Confluence restarts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29070].
  {panel}

I was wondering what would be the best way of building a menu of the existing spaces based on their labels?
I saw that some expensive plugins provide themes with horizontal navigation bars based on space labels and I was wondering whether a similar functionality could be achieved within a "home space" (used as landing page) with some macros, or whether it requires any theming, or writing plugins.

Practical example:

I have 
- space "Project 1" with label: projects
- space "Project 2" with label: projects
- space "Java best practices" with label: documentation
- space "JIRA documentation" with label: documentation

And I would like somehow to list (regardless of the layout)

- projects
-- Project 1
-- Project 2
- documentation 
-- Java best practices
-- JIRA documentation

Of course I don't expect a horizontal navbar without doing some theming, but at least being able to create a space that I would call "Home" (and set it as landing page for Confluence) in which I can build some blocks of spaces based on their labels.
fields.summary: Ability to categorise spaces as you create them

fields.description:
I have set up the CONF space on my server, according to your suggestion on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Local+Confluence+Documentation.

I did also update the help-paths.properties file per your instructions on this page.

Resulting this setup, the "What's New" feature is broken, because it now forms an URL like http:<myserver>/<docspace>/whatsnew/iframe .
This is not a valid Confluence URL.
"https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF/whatsnew/iframe" appears to be a redirection on the atlassian doc server which redirects to www.atlassian.com/en/software/confluence/whats-new-iframe/<version>
This mechanism doesn't exist on your customer's confluence instance, therefore the URL is broken when using a local documentation space.

According to investigation done by Atlassian support, the velocity template "whats-new.vm"  should be modified, so it does not build an URL to the local documentation server but always to the Atlassian server. (see CSP-100538)
fields.summary: Local Help breaks "Whats New" feature

fields.description:
h4. Description
Currently the 'Product Requirements' blueprint icon has the same specificity as the default icon listed in the sidebar resource:
* Blueprint main.css: .acs-nav-item.blueprint.requirements .icon
* Sidebar sidebar-icons.css: .acs-nav-item.pinned_page.blueprint .icon

In order for the blueprint style to override the sidebar css, the sidebar resources are being loaded first by being included as a dependency in the plugin descriptor. This means that all he sidebar resources are loaded despite the sidebar not being present on certain pages (e.g. Dashboard)


h4. Fix
Increase the specificity of the blueprint icon so it is not dependent on load order. This can be done by modifying com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/requirements/css/main.css in confluence-software-blueprints from ".acs-nav-item.blueprint.requirements .icon" to ".acs-nav-item.pinned_page.blueprint.requirements .icon".

The spacesidebar dependency can then be removed from atlassian-plugin.xml
fields.summary: Increase specificity of Product Requirement blueprints icon so sidebar resources do not need to be loaded in atl.general context

fields.description:
Mail periodically stops being sent, coinciding with a loss of connection between the Confluence server and the mail server. The emails back up in the Mail Queue, not the Error Queue, and can not be sent. The emails are subsequently lost when the server is restarted.

NB: In this scenario, sending a test email will still work, because it bypasses the mail queue and is sent directly. 

h3. Cause
Mail stops sending because the mail thread cannot connect to the server, and there is no timeout set. Consequently, the mail thread will continue to hang and mails will not be sent, even when the connection is re-established. Confluence sets the timeout to 0 programatically no matter what is specified in the Resource tag, and a 0 value means the thread will never timeout, and can never recover.

h3. Diagnosis
To find out if this issue is affecting you, take a couple of [external thread dumps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Generating+a+Thread+Dump+Externally] while the problem is occurring, spaced around 1 minute apart. If you see a thread that exists across both dumps which looks similar to the one under 'Symptoms' below, and references this method (or something similar eg SMTPMailServerImpl.connect()), then you are running in to this bug:
{code}
	- locked <0x0000000784505360> (a com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport)
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:166)
{code}

If you're unsure of the contents of the thread dump or if you need any help at any stage, feel free to contact [Support|https://support.atlassian.com].

h3. Workaround 1 - for mail configured directly through the front end of Confluence.
You will need to add the timeout properties to the database entry directly.
# Shut down Confluence. Unfortunately at this point you will lose any mail that is pending. There is currently no way to avoid this.
# Find the entry in the database:
{code}
select * from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.smtp.mail.accounts'
{code}
# Copy the entire contents of the BANDANAVALUE column to a text file
# Find the {{<property name="mail.smtp.timeout" value="0"/>}} property and edit it to {{<property name="mail.smtp.timeout" value="10000"/>}} to set a timeout of 10 seconds
# Add this property directly below it to set the connection timeout to 10 seconds : {{<property name="mail.smtp.connectiontimeout" value="10000"/>}}
# You should now have these two lines in the BANDANAVALUE text:
{code}
            <property name="mail.smtp.timeout" value="10000"/>
            <property name="mail.smtp.connectiontimeout" value="10000"/>
{code}
# Insert the value back in to the database *NB: do NOT copy the below query, this is an example only - you must use the full edited BANDANAVALUE you extracted in Step 3*:
{code}
update BANDANA set BANDANAVALUE = '<linked-hash-map>
     ....
            <property name="mail.smtp.timeout" value="10000"/>
            <property name="mail.smtp.connectiontimeout" value="10000"/>
     ....
</linked-hash-map>' where BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.smtp.mail.accounts';
{code}
# Restart Confluence

(!) If a new username or password is set through the GUI, the timeout value will be reset back to 0. If you change any of the configuration of the server, you will need to reapply this workaround.

Also, if after setting these timeouts, you encounter another connection problem which causes the mail processing to time out, the mails may end up in the Error Queue (Confluence Admin > Mail Queue). You may need to resend them from there.

h3. Workaround 2 - for JNDI mail server resources defined in the server.xml
# Edit the server.xml
# Add these two parameters to the resource tag:
{code}
mail.smtp.timeout="10000"
mail.smtp.connectiontimeout="10000"
{code}
# Restart Confluence

NB: If, after setting these timeouts, you encounter another connection problem which causes the mail processing to time out, the mails may end up in the Error Queue (Confluence Admin > Mail Queue). You may need to resend them from there.

h3. Symptoms

The thread that is stuck can look like this:

{noformat}
"scheduler_Worker-4" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007fce257b5000 nid=0xa39 runnable [0x00007fcda7bf9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:150)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:121)
	at com.sun.mail.util.TraceInputStream.read(TraceInputStream.java:110)
	at java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill(BufferedInputStream.java:235)
	at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(BufferedInputStream.java:254)
	- locked <0x0000000784507958> (a java.io.BufferedInputStream)
	at com.sun.mail.util.LineInputStream.readLine(LineInputStream.java:89)
	at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.readServerResponse(SMTPTransport.java:2188)
	at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.rcptTo(SMTPTransport.java:1699)
	at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.sendMessage(SMTPTransport.java:1120)
	- locked <0x0000000784505360> (a com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport)
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:166)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxSMTPMailServer.send(JmxSMTPMailServer.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.send(AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.send(PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.template.AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.execute(AbstractMailNotificationQueueItem.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.core.task.AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue$TaskDecorator.execute(AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.core.task.AbstractTaskQueue.flush(AbstractTaskQueue.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.core.task.AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue.flush(AbstractErrorQueuedTaskQueue.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.quartz.jobs.TaskQueueFlushJob.doExecute(TaskQueueFlushJob.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.quartz.jobs.AbstractJob.executeInternal(AbstractJob.java:88)
	at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.DelegatingClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.executeJob(DelegatingClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.surroundJobExecutionWithLogging(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.executeInternal(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:46)
	at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:199)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool$1.run(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:20)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Email sending stops due to mail job hanging in sendMessage()

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29028].
  {panel}

We use the red/yellow/green stars for a dashboard.  The resulting code  generated includes alternative text in 4.3.7, which is a positive change from the past version we used.  However, the alt for these stars is:

alt="(red star)"
alt="(star)"
alt="(green star)"

Alternative text should never have the parentheses unless needed to represent parenthetical information, which wouldn't include stars.

In addition, since you are providing multi-color stars, the color is important.  Perhaps not in all cases, but since it is in some it is necessary to include the color for all of the stars.  Therefore, the alts should be:

alt="red star"
alt="yellow star"
alt="green star"

This change will help the blind members of my team use Confluence.
fields.summary: Incorrect alternative text for emoticons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29021].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Insert a relative link to a Confluence page via Insert > Web Link > Address: /conf43/display/ds/test
# Save the page and you can see that the domain address is appended to the relative path e.g. http://www.atlassian.com/conf43/display/ds/test

Confluence no longer supports writing a web link as a relative URL, however you can get around this still by inserting a non-web link. If you look at the instructions on [Linking to Pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/uADGDg], the following ways will work effectively as relative links:

# Adding a link using autocomplete
# Adding a link using the Insert Link dialog (either search or recently viewed)

This kind of link does not store the base URL of your Confluence instance, it refers to the page by the (space id, page id) pair. This also means that if the page name changes, then the link will still work. If you left the link text the same as the page name originally, then it should automatically update to the new page name as well.

While the methods described above works for a single page, you cannot use autocomplete or the search to find the rss action page. For instance, you'd like to make a relative link to an rss feed such as this:
{code}
/createrssfeed.action?types=page&spaces=conf_all&title=pagename&labelString=work&excludedSpaceKeys %3D&sort=modified&maxResults=30&timeSpan=30&showContent=true&confirm=Create+RSS+Feed&os_authType=basic{code}

The methods described won't work because the link is not a Confluence page. Using the insert link dialog, you can insert this relative link as a web link but it will be saved as a absolute link instead. This is also becoming a problem when you are trying to move a staging server to a production server. You'll have to manually change the link individually to match the current production domain.
fields.summary: Prevent relative web links from being converted to absolute links

Attached has a screenshot of a JIRA Dashboard with three Confluence Page Gadgets; one showing a Confluence page with only text (on the right), the other two (on the left) should be showing Greenhopper (top) and JIRA (bottom) content, but instead they show errors.

fields.description:
Creating Gliffy diagrams in past versions of Confluence/Gliffy consisted of going to "Add", choosing "Gliffy Diagram", creating your diagram, saving it, and it would appear in its respective Wiki.

In the latest version (Confluence 4.3.5), you begin a Gliffy diagram in the same fashion, but once a diagram is finished and you click "Save", nothing appears in the Wiki.  I've tried several alternate methods, including clicking on the "Edit" option on the upper right of the Wiki page, trying to "Insert" a "Gliffy Diagram", but it brings me back to the "Edit Gliffy Diagram" page, and still wouldn't allow me to Save a diagram to the Wiki.

I was able to solve this partially, by "Exporting a PNG" from the Gliffy's edit page and inserting that into the Wiki's edit page.  This is still problematic in that it is just a still image, and not a Gliffy diagram that will allow me to make changes when necessary.

~ Daniel Tong
fields.summary: Gliffy - Saved Diagrams Don't Appear on Wiki

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29006].
  {panel}

The Junit Macro only allow two ways to insert the .xml report which is through URL or Directory URL as you can see from this attachment.
!example2.png|width=500!


An improvement request for this macro is proposed to allow  user to attach .xml files uploaded in the Confluence page with a specific label (for eg:Junit_report). The report of these XML files will be displayed by the Junit Report Macro automatically in the page according to the selected label. !example22.png|width=500!

The advantage of using this rather than using the Directory URL:
* Normal users (not only admin) can attach *multiple* XML files
* Less prone to errors since there is no need to type the full directory path manually
fields.summary: Add a functionality to the Junit Report Macro to display all attached .xml files with a certain label

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28997].
  {panel}

Hello,

We have a hosted confluence subscription. We are trying to script uploading files around 80MB in size and this usually causes our site to crash. Support said this was because of a bug in the SOAP (Axis) library. I also tried using xml-rpc with the same result. Which I think is really an out of memory problem on the hosted site. Support recommended the REST API but from what I see it only supports reads, not adding/modifying/uploading content?

Could the Confluence REST API be updated to support uploading of attachments, or either the SOAP or XML-RPC interfaces allow large files (80MB) on the hosted site? 

Or just add more heap space to our site if that would solve the issue.

thanks,
fields.summary: Add functionality to REST API for uploading attachments or modify either SOAP or xml-rpc interfaces to allow large files
